Easy to understand, fast, and effective.

Aceable

Would not refund or transfer class- and then did

Eventually figured out our issue

Revised Review:
I connected with their team that monitors reviews and they were able to help me. They set it up so my son could take the test again without paying more, and with the whole hour, he passed. This was the desired solution as I didn't want a refund, I just wanted him to be able to take the test fairly with the full time. They said that the issue with the shortened clock was on the state DMV's side (which, having been to the DMV a few times, I believe), but since we were paying Aceable, it's nice that they helped straighten it out. I wish that the original customer service representative would have done the same thing.

I'm moving my review from 1 star to 3 stars. In summary, there were some technical difficulties that the original CSR couldn't or wouldn't fix, but after posting my original review, the second CSR who reached out was able to resolve. I'm on the fence whether I'll use them again for my next son.

Original Review:
My son took the drivers ed course, and it was fine. He took the test and didn't pass the first time (not a huge surprise, given how fast he went through some lessons). After him really studying, I paid for a second test (students are allowed three attempts, requiring an additional $25 each for the 2nd and 3rd), but when it started, the hour timer was already more than half over. He hurried through and tried to take it, but with literally only twenty minutes, he rushed and didn't pass. We immediately contacted Aceable (25 minutes after the test started) to inform them and asked for a chance to retake the exam with a full hour, but they said there was nothing they could do - no refund and no retake. Would he have passed if he had the full hour? Maybe, but we'll never know because he was only given 20 minutes. I asked them to check their logs or metadata to check on the problem, but they wouldn't or couldn't. I understand needing to work through technology bugs, but the customer service failure is less excusable.

Sincronizar lectura al idioma Español

(Español)
Lo único necesario es que la voz no sale en español. Es algo muy necesario cuando hispanos hablantes no hablan ingles.
Es muy necesario si las lecciones son seleccionadas para leer en español sean leídas por la voz al Idioma Español de (España)y no sea leída en ingles como se escucha. Esto es un error de sincronización que puede crear confusion a la hora que los estudiantes del curso que solo hablan idioma Español estén recibiendo el contenido.
El Español de España es más generalizado y contiene un vocabulario más formal como el Inglés de Inglaterra. No deben escoger el español de países Hispanohablante porque suele traer confusión.No pueden crear la expectativa que todos los hispanos hablantes deben obligatoriamente escuchar y entender las diferentes palabras porque son de un país o otro. Por eso el Español de España es más generalizado.

Best defensive driving course out there

This is an excellent course to take for defensive driving. It's super well designed in terms of layout, progression, and content. The app is a fantastic way to complete the course since it has a solid UI and can be accessed any time. You can exit at literally any point and the course will remember your progress to the exact second. No doubt the best part is the writing and humor. It's hard to make a mandatory 6hr course engaging but the creators of the course did a really good job of adding in a chuckle or two per chapter. The tests themselves are easy and straightforward with no stress when it comes to worrying about retaking a chapter. Really glad I signed up for this course!

Fantastic Course (Mostly) to Learn From!

It was a perfect course for me to learn how to drive safely! My only issues with it were that the “Street Trivia” videos were pretty cheesy, I didn’t feel that the final lesson about water safety in lesson 11 was all that important, and that the unit on drugs was necessary and helpful, but it felt as though they went into a little too much detail with those drugs. People didn’t need to know all the things that can make them high, (such as hairspray and glue) and they felt a little too in depth about all the physical actions they cause. But overall, I would recommend this to all my friends for Driver’s-Ed, and really liked learning from Ace.

The Best Online Driving Courses App

Minor hiccups with iOS setup - you need to sign in in Help section to see your courses - I would fix it as it is not obvious and before you figure it out, you maybe lost and call for their super-active help line. Once logged in to your account, everything is smooth. Few times after video plays on iOS it would show black screen with big white X and the best solution for this I found is to switch to Desktop. It only happened twice during the course and only in iOS app, but I would still fix it. Still 5 big shining stars! Reason: no app is perfect, but the attitude of their help line and easy course flow did not leave me any room for lower rating.

My opinion on all the courses (content/material)

This driving course is very educational and for new drivers and it's easy to learn all the information as well. The reason I found it easier to learn with Acebale is because the course comes with audio (which is optional for an extra $5). But even without the audio the course provides videos, humor, recaps of content, and questions through the course to make sure you are paying attention and soaking the information properly. When I get the questions being provided correct, I know that I am learning. At the end of each chapter in the sections. You are given a 10 question quiz, which test you on the material in the chapter. If you do well and answer everything properly its very exciting and it feels like you are a step closer to your license. I would recommend this course to anyone trying to get their license.

If you ever need a sure fire way to get your license, Aceable is definitely the way to go.

We have utilized Aceable's driving course for my daughter's driver's education, as well as defensive driving. Both courses are well done!

Dismiss my ticket.

Very easy to read format of Safe driving course. I sit & studied 8 hours long !!! I passed the all questions. No final Exam. Then get my certificate in 1 minute ( cost $10 ) deliver to my Email. Other website charge $29 !!! Then I submitted to the traffic court same day I appeared. The judge gave me dismiss ticket paper ( if not I get fine of $250) and the judge still request you take the course and resubmit within 90 days !!! Luckily I went ahead to do some research , and took the course before going to the court. The court fee is $144 is unavoidable. So finally I save $250 & dismiss my ticket in my driving record. Also you can submit this course to get discount on car insurance. Highly recommend Aceable !!!

Experienced British driver learning Texan driving........!!!

At first I thought 6 hours of sitting in front of a computer would be dull but this was a really enjoyable and informative way of learning to drive even though I have been driving for 30 years in the UK! I even used the App which was really easy to use. The course can be done on a computer and/or app which made it easier to complete. The course content was very thought provoking too especially during the sections regarding texting and how drivers can easily be distracted. Having recently moved over here and witnessed first hand how some people drive (or at least think they can drive sensibly) I am now more of a defensive driver than I was back home. I am in shock when I see how drivers sometimes don't indicate, swerve in and out of lanes, TEXTING, putting make up on and just generally having no regard for others. But getting back to the course, the whole process from registering and having step by step guidance was easy to follow and explained clearly. It wasn't boring to follow and the help from Ace the Robot was great. I found it very interesting and didn't fall asleep!! Highly recommended!!

Amazingggggg

Amazing, easy to learn, they make sure you’re paying attention by asking questions about the topic you’re learning about. They have so many practice quizzes to make sure you’re prepared for most of your subjects. Also they have everything in audio form and text form so if you are the type of person that has a hard time focusing or learning by reading every single word of text Ace will read it out for you. Simple to learn and they try their best to never make it boring by giving Ace a bunch of random jokes and they have pictures of stuff you don’t know about as they’re teaching you like: what does an intersection look like? What does a t-section look like? They even show videos, the most interesting one to me was how to fix your vehicle. Or how to deal with certain situations such as when your vehicle gets stuck in mud, you have to deflate your tires a little to get out. Also love how Ace talks about the importance of not texting and driving, they had a whole section about it and so many videos and questions.

More than just a driver’s Ed course

At first this course looked daunting with 12 levels, but once I started to actually do it, it went by fast. Ace was a good teacher and companion along the way. This course was easy for the right reasons. They say, “The best teachers just remind you of what you already know”; most of this was common sense and pretty self explanatory but it also gives you more than you payed for: it gives you information on insurance, buying a car, water safety, what to do in an emergency, etc. Overall I think I am a better, more informed driver than had I done an alternative drivers Ed course. Because of this course I can now drive legally and responsible in the state of Texas ;)
Thank you.

pretty reasonable traffic school course

Overall, this was an easy online traffic school course I took and I timed myself and it did take about 8 hours to finish including the surveys and the final test. There was some humor in the writing but I purposely did not want to sign up for an improv traffic school. It cost $19. I did learn more about stuff I probably didn't need to know but a good refresher overall. There is one discrepancy that I found on Level 7, Chapter 1 on page 8 which led me to get wrong answer on final assessment although I did pass (thus the 4 instead of 5 star review). It shows that there are most fatal collisions between 6 AM to 11:59 AM by the actual number 2158 in 2017 but strangely the wording afterwards state that the afternoon and evening are the most dangerous - implying there are more fatalities in the afternoon and evening so I was quite confused with what was the correct answer if the wording is wrong and does not coincide with the number.

Best I have seen

My wife insisted I take this course to lower our insurance, and I was pleasantly surprised by the ease and flawless app technology. No glitches switching between devices, nice bite-sized bits of material, solid videos, and even a bit entertaining along the way. In Texas, the law is 5 hours with a one hour break, so I had to wait to take the last 4 question assessment to kill time, but it was not a problem.

My suggestions for the developers would be to make the security questions in a bigger font for old eyes. The course was easy to read (I chose not to pay for audio reading to me), but the pop ups to verify my identity were very small and hard for an old guy to read. I also wish there was a place to verify the drivers license I typed in on the profile page and an option that explicitly says the reason for the course is to lower insurance. The options were to Dismiss a Ticket and None of the Above which was okay, but I would have felt more confident with Insurance as a choice.

Overall, a great experience. Highly recommended.

Informative and Effective (with a bit of cringe)

My family and friends have been using Aceable to learn driving and have all sincerely enjoyed it. At times, dealing with Aceable was a bit repetitive and cringy. However, it is understandable that despite the cringe in the videos, there was a moral lesson in each video.

I appreciated the fact that we could take the assessment tests with automatic scoring and retake was always available to those who needed it. In addition, Aceable is a very observing, detailed, and informative platform for driving that the information provided is useful and made me (and even my parents, who have been driving for 30+) learn something we've never known before.

Yesterday, I was able to finish all lessons of Aceable and my confidence in driving has skyrocketed.

Overall, I have to agree that Aceable is 100% worth even till the very end. My parents had to purchase the class 4 times (for me and my other siblings) and we all have no regrets.

Thank you, Aceable, for the amazing boost in confidence with driving. I will forever appreciate you.

Too Verbose, Long, and Uninformative

It can take a very long time to complete the entire course honestly. Fortunately, you can just scroll through everything and take the quizzes, relying on your own existing knowledge, Google, and training questions where Aceable provides correct answers.

Few videos in the course are still not optional and could keep slowing you down a bit.

It would be great to have more informative and less wordy text, organized in bigger chunks. Some chapters now are more than 100 pages (one sentence per page often). Considering around 10-20 chapters per level, and 9 levels, some extra jokes start to sound not funny or at least out of place.

The following areas could be covered in more depth and provide rally valuable information to new and experienced drivers:
1. Driving in the snow and other difficult weather conditions.
2. Defensive driving (more details and examples, beyond basic calls to be attentive and scan everything around).
3. Even simplest actions (stop signs, traffic lights) on more in-depth level (how to start after stop sign or traffic light if sight is blocked or obscured).

Highly Recommend!

As an adult driver in quarantine, getting my Learners Permit was stressful to even think about. I did not wish to go to a class of Sophmores in High School and I also did not want to go straight into an adult class. Finding Aceable has been a lifesaver, and it teaches me everything I need to know in a very easy to understand format. Also as an adult with learning disabilities, Aceable provides videos that demonstrate the situations it describes in words. I highly recommend this to all those learning to drive, especially those taking the adult course. It only takes 6 hours!!
The only complaints I have have to do with my learning disability. It would really benefit me if I had the words read to me instead of reading myself as my dyslexia and ADHD make things very hard for me. Other than that, Aceable is very friendly and I highly recommend!!

-Honey

In general the course is great…but…

In general the course is great,,easy and convenient to follow. Only caveat is the pricing structure, convoluted and with “strings” attached. The price as advertised includes a discount related to an unsolicited subscription based service, under the promise you can cancel anytime afterwards (of course you will forget and get charged a few times before you do). Then, there is a 10 dollar optional charge for an “instant” certificate after completion, and it’s very hard to understand if/why you would need to pay for this extra, specially in this the age of virtual communications. At the end of the day the real cost of the course/certificate is more in the order of 50 dollars, by any practical purposes (unless you take the subscription, etc. blah , blah , blah). Too bad you get feel that you are getting scammed or deceived by otherwise and excellent offering.

Great course, drop some jargon and maybe time.

Super streamlined, easy to navigate and definitely would recommend. The only complaint I have is that as cute as I find the Aceable mascot, because the timer is based on how much text there is on a page, I really felt like there was way too much humorous jargon from the robot that caused the timer to be longer than it should’ve. Sometimes there were just entire pages of complete jargon from the robot I would have to wait on before moving on; it was almost like being forced to take in a joke. I appreciate the humor, but not being forced into it. To branch off that, although I understand you definitely want people to consume the content and not just breeze through the course, I found the timers to be way too long. I even tried to read the slides out loud quite slowly, and even then I would always be left with another 10 seconds to go. As my family watched me do the course, they commented that the pace almost felt as if this course was designed for stupid or inept people with very slow comprehension. Personally, I think it would be okay to adjust it to people with average comprehension and reading (like 400-500WPM), and if they don’t understand something they can always stay on the slide after the timer has gone. However, when the timer is forced to be that long I feel it serves to annoy people more than it does help them.
Still, these are just very minor pickings and inconveniences. Overall, the course was excellent for what it was and I recommend anyone to take Aceable over the (excuse me) crap they offer in person. I did find myself sad to part with the robot at the end haha.

I paid the surprisingly reasonable fee and downloaded the app. I was prepared for an annoying snoozefest, and was pleasantly surprised when the course actually made me chuckle out loud a few times (it still made me snooze a bit, but that's the nature of the material). It took several hours (I broke it off into several sittings) for me to complete, but it was well worth it to have the speeding ticket expunged from my record. I hope I never get another ticket, but if I do, I will definitely use Aceable in the future.

My Experience with Aceable

This Driver's Ed Course is great for teens. The lessons are easy to understand and they are structured to help relate to teenagers. Throughout the lessons, there are several videos with examples of how to do certain maneuvers, etc., and videos that show you real people's stories related to the lesson. As well as videos, there are questions throughout the chapters to test you on what you remembered from that chapter. After each lesson, you will be given a 10 question assessment that has questions from throughout the entire lesson.

This course was amazing. Instead of having to go to a drivers ed class, I could do it at my own pace, within my schedule, anywhere I wanted. The course also gives you step-by-step instructions on how to get your permit/driver's license and what you need to bring to the DVM for your appointments. Overall I had a great experience with Aceable.

I loved it

I loved it! It was informative but not boring :)

There are several things that went into…

There are several things that went into my rating.
1) Ease of using the program; my teen is constantly on the go. He was able to work at his own pace on his laptop or phone. Excellent.
2) Record keeping; I could easily access my son's progress with notations as to the percentage completed and days left to finish.
3) Alerts; the program sent texts if a significant amount of time had lapsed since the last login or if my son was fast approaching the deadline for completion.
4) Certificate was received quickly.

Simple and fun to use, but had technical issues with logging in

I am currently taking a Driver's Ed course on Aceable and the experience has been pleasant so far. Everything is simple to use and understand and progress is always saved, so I can close the Aceable tab, open the app on my phone, and continue where I left off. The character Ace is also a welcome aspect and serves to lighten the mood in what would otherwise be a mundane learning experience.

However, there were technical issues. When I signed up, I did not receive the initial email to set up my student account and couldn't log in. I tried to send a password reset email multiple times but it didn't work - it took over half an hour for the password reset email(s) to arrive. When it did and I entered a new password, the site said it wasn't working at the moment. I had to wait some more time before requesting, waiting for the email, and trying again, after which I successfully reset (set for the first time) my password and could finally log in.

The worst customer service imaginable! I have two teenage children and apparently their system is not advanced enough to be capable of associating the same parent email address with two children. I tried to call and was placed on hold for an hour and a half before a machine said I would be disconnected because they are closing for lunch!

The course teaches road fundamentals and rules on special scenarios that may come up while on the road. Aceable is the driving Ed app for Teens!

Aceable is the driving Ed app for teens. Whether you don't have time or the money to attend driving school, aceable makes it super easy to learn how to drive! As long as you have someone over 21 years old to oversee your activities. Going through the courses was seamless and I even learned some new things, all for the low price of $60 dollars. I would recommend this to anyone because Aceable is worth every penny, from start to finish!

Buyer Beware! be prepared for issues.

I purchased the Aceable PTDE program for my teen mostly because I couldnt find any parents who could guide me towards a PTDE program that was well recommended. Aceable was 10$ cheaper than its competitors alongside a special offer that i figured i may be able to use. After purchasing the software, I had my child try and log on with no success. We spent hours trying to reset the password and calling the toll free number on the website with no success. I left an email with their support division and I was surprised that a company offering an online product takes 5-7 days to get back to its customers. I figured that I would ask for a refund and start from scratch but Aceable had other plans for that as well. instead of refunding my money like I requested, I got an email 6 days later with a link and a temporary password. I tried the link and it works fine. My child is now using the program with no problems. I don't understand why I had to wait a week to be able to use the software and why I wasn't issued the refund when I asked for it?

Aceable is the best program for your teenager in order to learn how to drive. It makes learning how to drive easy and understandable. I doesn't take forever either. Aceable made getting my permit so much easier than any other program would of, and this program has some serious discounts. My permit would have cost $100 dollars, Aceable made it $16 dollars! This program breaks everything you need to know about driving into easy understandable chunks, with only 12 levels. You could have your provisional license in about 6 months to a year. Did I mention this course is fun? It's really fun! Did I also mention that Aceable has been approved in almost every state in the United States of America? Yeah, that's a really big deal. Get your teenager Aceable, and they will become one of the best drivers out there!

Ridiculous!!!!!!!! My son son has now taken the test twice…

My son son has now taken the test twice and I have brought him up to DPS twice only to be told the certificate is invalid bc of a glitch in Aceables system. There is never anyone to talk to on the phone at Aceable. The only option is to text or email. I text them and it took 2 days to get a response even though I said we were at DPS waiting to get this resolved. They couldn’t help me bc they couldn’t find him by my number. My son emailed and was told he had to take the test again. Fine. He took another hour and did that. He was given the same exact invalid certificate. DPS can’t help bc Aceable keeps sending the invalid certificate to the state. Mind you, I have taken off work to get this done each time. My son, who already has extreme anxiety, is now upset. This is ridiculous! Even the Manager at DPS feels bad but there is nothing she can do. Maybe someone at Aceable will respond to this review bc I can’t seem to get them any other way.

There was one comment though that you may want to consider changing and it was in reference to waiting in line at a drivethru in the environment/envisions section. The robot said to just go inside and that there was no real reason to be waiting in line in your car, as opposed to waiting in line inside. It’s a just a bit ableist and it leaves out people traveling with small children, and folks who have difficulty getting in and out of their car for physical or mental health reasons. I know it was meant to be a harmless joke, but it might actually hurt someone who falls under one of those categories.

Quick and Easy Driver’s Ed

Aceable provides all of the materials one would need to be successful in obtaining a permit and/or license. It uses a level>chapter>page system and is easy to navigate and easy to use. During chapters there are questions related to the reading and after at the end of each level there is a 10 question assessment pertaining to the previous information from the level.
There are also extra tutorial videos in 3D VR that can be helpful for visualizing how to parallel park, merge, and more.
The bottom line here is this; it’s easy. No hassles, no frustrations, and being very user friendly. I recommend this to all of my friends. However, make sure you buy an account using the website since it has a constant discount that restarts daily.

I will be 16 next month and I really wanted to get my permit before then but I thought it would be too hard and take too long to study for but then I found Aceable and signed up immediately! I took the drug test, alcohol, and drivers test course. It was actually super fun! I actually enjoyed learning so much! There were memes and jokes and videos through out the course. it touched a lot on texting and driving and drinking and driving and drug and alcohol abuse which i learned A LOT from! I've learned more in this course than i have in school. I could have finished this course is just 1 day but i wanted to stretch it out and not rush, i finished my course in just 4 days! Driver's Ed Done Right

When my girlfriend showed me Aceable I originally wasn't sure what to think about it. She had started it before I had so I would glance over as she was working on it to see what it was all about. Before long though I found myself reading each of the pages she was on as she was going through the course. I ended up getting it for myself because I never had taken a driver's ed course and when I was reading her screens I was retaining the knowledge of the pages. It was easy to use, and the ability to work on it on multiple devices and have it save your progress was truly wonderful.

The only problem I had was sometimes the timers seemed much longer than necessary. However, I read a bit quickly so I'm not sure if it's just because of my reading speed or if perhaps some timers were too long.

Overall, I definitely feel confident in my ability to take my permit test once my appointment approaches. Thanks Aceable!

100% Recommend the Aceable Online Defensive Driving Course

I took the Aceable online Defensive Driving course to dismiss a traffic ticket. Everything about the process was easy and extremely timely with no glitches, from downloading and using the app to receiving my course certificate and Driving Record as easily printable documents. As for course content, I’ve been driving 30+ years and I picked up some refresh and some new pointers that I was able to relay to the other drivers in my family. I was also pleased there was no final exam...assessment was built into the end of each chapter rather than saving it all to a “final” at the end of the course. I 100%recommend this online course for anyone, student driver to experienced driver trying to dismiss a ticket.

Great Website, Limited Time

I liked using Aceable. I was able to look through the notes, videos, and small questions I was given throughout the course, and I was able to use it confortably at home or occasionally in the car. A problem I encountered, however, was that I am only allowed up to 2 hours of the course per day, and I wish 3 hours was the max so I could get the course done quicker and about a week earlier, while I got my course done in about 3 weeks. I did most of it during my spring break, which was a good and convenient time to use Aceable since I had much more time. Overall, I would recommend Aceable to a friend or somebody wanting to obtain their license with the required driving classes they would need if they are under 18 years of age.

Best Driving Course To Experience! A Lot Of Thought Put Into It

Honestly I didn't want to do an online driving course at first because I thought it would be boring and harder for me to pay attention but I found Aceable and decided to try it out for a variety of reasons. For one I love the fact that you can access it at any time; I work and go to school so its hard to find time to go to another in person class; this feature lets me do my Drivers Ed whenever I have spare time. It also is very great with keeping me active and interested in learning; I find myself sometimes laughing at the side jokes they throw in. Lets not forget about the great videos and occasional breaks. This is my honest opinion; I find it hard to pay attention to most things but Aceable has done a great job with keeping me eager to learn about driving and doing it safely. Overall I think this is a wonderful App/Website/etc. and more people should use it, especially if they are like me and don't have much time in the day to sit in a classroom. Wonderful job guys, keep it up! I can confidently say I will actually miss Driving school once I am finished.

Absolutely amazing!

The price that this company places on their FL permit courses is much lower than others. They make the content relevant and interesting, and although some of the memes might be crude "fellow kids" attempts, you can tell that they're trying their hardest to make this an enjoyable experience. It really pays off! The course's pacing is reasonable, the information is wonderful, the videos really help in visualizing concepts, and the format makes it easy to learn anywhere. Overall, I highly recommend Aceable to anyone wishing to get their Florida Learner's Permit!

Best class out there!

Aceable is not your typical online driver’s ed. Aceable is by far the best class available. The memes keep you engaged and the lessons are worded in a much more entertaining way than other classes (thanks to no other than Ace the robot, your instructor). I was able to complete part of the class while on-the-go using my iPhone, and the rest using my laptop. The app and site are very user-friendly and easy to navigate. The videos are no longer than a few minutes and the timer for each page is just right. I finished this all in a few hours, just in time for my driving test. Definitely recommended! You will not regret choosing them.

Overall

Overall, I enjoyed taking my driver's Ed through Aceable. The format and colors made it an engaging experience, and while most of the jokes were rather cringey, some were actually funny. The videos were helpful demonstrations. While I feel there could be a little more elaboration on some ideas, all the main points from the driver's manual were covered very well, and the repetition of certain concepts aided memory. The end checklist of items to bring and steps to take to apply for one's permit or license was also very helpful.

Good if you like your legal name

While the lessons are comprehensive, and does what it intends to do well, there are still some areas Aceable could improve. For one, I would like there to be a feature one could put their preferred name that they would like the lessons to refer to them as, in addition to their legal name. This could be helpful for both people who use nicknames and trans people. As a trans person who has yet to get their name legally changed, seeing my deadname used to refer to me in such a casual manner as it is used through Aceable is jarring and a bit upsetting. Besides this and a few grammar errors, this site is fine for learning to drive.

Parent vs. Educator

Very educational, but poorly forecasted. The course itself is fantastic, and I feel ready for the road. However, if you buy the driving school instruction, you will complete 32 hours of learning before driving, whereas the parent taught option has you learning for only 6 hours beforehand. This was poorly communicated, and I was pressed against my DMV permit deadline. I hope this review makes a many people aware of this difference as possible.

5$/month roadside assistance billing scam…

In my opinion the 5$/month roadside assistance is a chickenshit scam ... I've seen Aceable's response to others complaining about the 5$ month charge and they respond with BS about it being hassle free cancelation. It's not. I follow the link to cancel, I enter my email and it sends me a response email that i entered an incorrect email. However, I can log on to the main site with that email and its the same one i used to pay for the course so I know its correct. If this were legit they would provide a direct link to from their main site after you log in. Sneaky slimy marketing/billing BS.

One thing that I really liked about it was that it went over the information and then had a mini quiz at the end of each chapter. That made it very easy to remember the information. I did have a few doubts about whether or not it was legit, but after I was able to get my permit there was no doubt. In my opinion even without the pandemic this is the way that everyone should do drivers ed because it’s on your time and you’re comfortable with the person that is teaching you to drive.

Affordable without any compromise

Aceable Parent Taught Driver's Ed has been very good for me! The $60 minimum course fee may seem sketipcal, but it's honestly a HUGE DEAL compared to other courses with some being hundreds of dollars. Its simple slide-show like layout is very good at providing information without it being boring. The website layout if easy to navigate, and has a nice appearance. The available VR videos are pretty cool even without a headset. I know it sounds a bit strange, but I also like the Aceable robot "explanaing" the material, it's not boring at all compared to textbook-like instruction. Another thing, even though it's clearly staged, the street trivia team videos are pretty neat as a tiny break inside the chapters! Aceable is honestly such a good Driver's Ed program for me, it seems like a good portion of the content isn't the bare-bones, barely qualifying as a government recognized course, and I could be right!

Easy to read and listen to

Easy to read and listen to. Very clear on all subjects. I really enjoyed using Aceable, I found myself doing the drivers ed for multiple hours during the day. Hello, I recently finished the Instructors Taught Driver’s Ed Course and did enjoy it, though I do feel there should be one issue addressed. Aceable automatically pairs the student with an in-person driving school/ instructor. One suggestion I would like to make is to have the option for the student to choose their own school instead, rather than having to request a refund for the voucher portion in the course. Other than that, this course has been very informative and helpful in the process of earning a license. Thank you.

Old Guy who Just Moved Back to Houston

I have recently moved back to Houston and my Texas DL has lapsed so I needed to re sit. I found Aceable on line and it provided me with a quick, flexible option that avoided the pain of having to sit In a classroom for 6 hours. The cost is very reasonable and the process is very simple and easy to follow from the initial signing on through to completion and receiving your certificate once you pass. 6 hours on road signs and the rules of driving etc is always going to be tough going but this course tries to keep it as light and interesting as possible, the system enables you to stop and start as you want on any device you want. As you would expect you can not short cut the program and you are tested frequently to make sure you are paying attention as you would in a classroom environment. You are then given a final test on completion which if you are successfully provides you with a certificate enabling you to go to the next stage. I passed first time, but I have been driving for 40 plus years now so I guess I should.
All in all a good easy flexible option which avoids the pain of classrooms. Definitely recommend.

Get it, what are you waiting for?

I originally decided to use Aceable because one of my friends had recommended it to me to get my learner's license, and I'm really glad I listened to them! The program is a little more pricey than the standard options provided in my state, but it's so worth it. I really liked Aceable mainly because not only was it informative and easy to follow, but the lessons were also very engaging. The cringey memes and the effort to be "relatable" was laughable but it kept me paying attention. Not to mention, I appreciated the level of quality and detail provided in visuals, especially in the animated and 360 VR videos, they were extremely helpful. The resources provided outside of the lessons were great, including the DPS checklists and the tutorials on filling out required documents for getting a permit/provisional license. Overall, Aceable is very much top-notch, and I would definitely recommend to a friend!

Don't expect them to send the S number to get your permit. Takes forever. Still waiting.

My daughter took the test on Saturday and Sunday and completed it by 3pm. It is Wednesday and still no reports have been sent to the DMV office. We went there and went through the wait, picture taking, etc. only to get to the end and find out no scores sent though well past the 48 hour time they tell you. So now we have to go back whenever we finally do get the test sent in.
Update: Make sure that when your child gets the email which says -Great you've completed it and now all you need to do is go to the permit office, that you read the small print which says- if you haven't completed the knowledge exam, you'll have to do it at the office. The team at Aceable sent me an email after I screenshot her email and told us how she still had to complete another test- It's 40 questions timed and they must pass it to get the certificate and S number. She took it and two days later, after another email and request I finally got the S number to write down and go to the DMV where she was able to get her permit. So it did all work out but don't expect a quick turnaround. I changed it from 2 stars to 3 because my daughter thought she'd finished it, as did I after getting the email, but I still think Aceable needs to do a better job of clearly relaying this information on the exam.

Aceable is a very informative, interactive and flexable approach to drivers education (and not to mention fun)! Downloading the Aceable mobile app was especially convenient for me as I was able to work on my drivers education essentially anywhere I found time to do so. In my case, I was planning on transferring to a driving school to finish up my instructor taught behind the wheel portion of the program, but once Coronavirus hit, that was soon out of the picture. Fortunately, Aceable made it an easy second option for me to transfer to the parent taught program with a $20 fee. I highly recommend choosing Aceable as your next step to earning your driver license!

It's a little cheesy for kids my age

It's a little cheesy for kids my age, I felt a little childish t times-but it did keep it interesting, rather than just chucking info at me. I didn't feel entirely like I was drinking from a firehose either. Those street trivia team videos were funny-but only because of the hired actors. It was clear that those guys weren't actual people off the streets...the whole set up felt pretty forced. However, it was a good brain break from all the info being taught. I think it is a good thought-but the execution needs to be better. As a theatre kid, I'd say not many-if any-kids my age are gonna just believe people are that oblivious, you know? But, if the purpose was soley to entertain-then the mission was accomplished. Overall, a great program...I only to slightly fed up with the timers coming with the instructor taught plan. But I understand the need for them-I'm just a fast reader. Thanks Ace for making me laugh, and helping me out! I loved it!

Watch for Monthly Billing on "Free" Roadside Assistance

I have no complaints about the course but Aceable uses a very deceptive business practice that automatically enrolls you in a "free" roadside assistance program that charges an additional $5 per month. I have not been back through their checkout process but if you purchase the course, make to watch for whatever choice turns off/disables this option.

Aceable did refund the charges but I'm disgusted that it was even an issue that needed to be resolved. If they really need to offer the feature, it must be option that's disabled by default. This is a completely dishonest business practice.
